instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message:
This board came in for no boot, looked over the entire board, and no signs of liquid or burned caps, super clean, paying close attention I noticed <CAPACITOR>C7372</CAPACITOR>(PPBUS _S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS & ground) was burned, took it off and replaced it, still did not boot up, any ideas?

Board has also been ultrasonic cleaned after removed burned capacitor, 

<DIODE>D7005</DIODE>

PIN 1 - 1.09V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
PIN 2 - 16.5V PP18V5 DCIN ISOL R
PIN 3 - 16.2V <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message: Probably also killed the ppbus fuse (F7040? schematic not in front of me). Check both sides.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message:
Yeah, brain fart again lol Thank you!! 

I was thinking too much on this one,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message:
ok, so I went ahead and replaced PPBUS fuse, without [LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial][SIZE=12px]<CAPACITOR>C7372</CAPACITOR>(PPBUS _S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS) being put on, put a new capacitor on, and it burned it again :/

not sure whats going on there, any ideas?[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message: You likely still have a short circuit. What is the resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message:
I ended up leaving the capacitor off, since it there are many in the line, must have been a short somewhere,

thank you guys!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont boot up - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.
threads.message: I still think you should put effort into finding a suitable replacement cap, but I suppose this can be considered solved now.
